summary: Harriet Tubman lived most of her life working to free her people. She ran away to the North as a young slave and frequently returned to the South to help other slaves escape. She became a famous leader of the underground railroad, a secret network of households that provided food and shelter to runaway slaves. Harriet led groups of slaves from one point to another on the perilous journey north, traveling only at night and hiding during the day. Her daring rescues helped hundreds of slaves escape to freedom.
quotes: a reward of forty thousand dollars was offered for her capture
